alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Pushmataha (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 7:40AM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Pushmataha, east central Haskell, eastern Sequoyah, southeastern Adair and Le Flore Counties through 815 AM CST... At 740 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Brushy Lake State Park to 7 miles northeast of Fanshawe to 5 miles south of Albion. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Sallisaw... Poteau... Pocola... Muldrow... Heavener... Roland... Spiro... Panama... Talihina... Wister... Howe... Bokoshe... Fanshawe... Gans... Cameron... Albion... Talimena State Park... Brushy... Brushy Lake State Park... Whitesboro... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 304 and 327. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
